tit.cmt: ○○院の場合は、Kizo-inのようにハイフンを使用しています。

sen.j: 喜蔵院（きぞういん）は、奈良県吉野郡吉野町にある大峰山の護持院。
sen.e: Kizo-in Temple is a Goji-in temple of Mt. Omine located in Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Kizo-in Temple is a Goji-in temple of Mt. Omine located in Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Kizo-in Temple is a Goji-in Temple of Mt. Omine located in Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「Goji-in temple」を「Goji-in Temple」に修正しました。

sen.e: Bekkaku Honzan (Extraordinary head temple) of Honzan Shugenshu sect.
It is the Bekkaku Honzan (Head temple of special status) of Honzan Shugenshu sect.
sen.cmt: It isを挿入し、extraordinary > special status.
sen.e: It is the Bekkaku Honzan (Head temple of special status) of Honzan Shugenshu sect.
En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (a sacred site for pilgrimage).
It is also an En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (a sacred site for pilgrimage).
sen.cmt: It is alsoを挿入しました。
sen.e: It is also an En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (a sacred site for pilgrimage).
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yoshinosan.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yoshinosan.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yoshinosan.
The founder is Chisho Daishi Enchin.
It was founded by Chisho Daishi Enchin.
It was founded by Chisho Daishi Enchin.

sen.j: 桜の名所として知られる吉野山の中腹に位置する。
sen.e: The temple is located at the midpoint up Mt. Yoshino known as a famous place for cherry blossoms.
The temple is located halfway of Mt. Yoshino, a place famous for cherry blossoms.
sen.cmt: midpoint > halfway. known as a famous place > a place famous.
sen.e: The temple is located halfway of Mt. Yoshino, a place famous for cherry blossoms.

sen.j: 平安時代に京都聖護院の一院として創建された。
sen.e: It was founded as a branch temple of Shogo-in Temple located in Kyoto City in the Heian period.
It was founded as a branch temple of Shogo-in Temple located in Kyoto City in the Heian period.
It was founded as a branch temple of Shogo-in Temple located in Kyoto City in the Heian period.

sen.j: 江戸時代には儒学者熊沢蕃山が滞在したとされ、境内にはその際の句碑が残されている。
sen.e: It is said that Banzan KUMAZAWA, a Confucian scholar, stayed in the temple and that there is a stone with his poem engraved on it in the precincts of the temple.
It is said that Banzan KUMAZAWA, a Confucian scholar, stayed in the temple and that there is a stone with his poem engraved on it in the precincts of the temple.
It is said that Banzan KUMAZAWA, a Confucian scholar, stayed in the temple and that there is a stone with his poem engraved on it in the precincts of the temple.
Statue of Yoshino Great Tengu
Statue of Yoshino Great Tengu
Statue of Yoshino Great Tengu
The year and the sculptor are unknown.
The year and the sculptor are unknown.
The year and the sculptor are unknown.
Sakura no fu (poem of cherry blossoms)
Sakura no fu (poem of cherry blossoms)
Sakura no fu (poem of cherry blossoms)
Written by Roko MIKUMA, a painter, in 1796.
Written by Roko MIKUMA, a painter, in 1796.
Written by Roko MIKUMA, a painter, in 1796.

sen.j: 近鉄吉野線吉野駅 (奈良県)より吉野ロープウェイ乗り換え「吉野山」下車、徒歩約40分
sen.e: Take the Yoshino Ropeway from Yoshino Station on the Kintetsu Yoshino Line (Nara Prefecture), get off at 'Yoshinoyama' and walk for about 40 minutes.
Take the Yoshino Ropeway from Yoshino Station on the Kintetsu Yoshino Line (Nara Prefecture), get off at 'Yoshinoyama' and walk for about 40 minutes.
Take the Yoshino Ropeway from Yoshino Station on the Kintetsu Yoshino Line (Nara Prefecture), get off at 'Yoshinoyama' and walk for about 40 minutes.
